video_description:
Motorcycle USA cruises the mountain roads on the 2010 Indian Chief Roadmaster, the new cruiser motorcycle from Indian Motorcycles. Check out the full 2010 Indian Chief Roadmaster review at www.motorcycle-usa.com.
http://www.motorcycle-usa.com/155/4370/motorcycle-article/2010-indian-chief-roadmaster-first-ride.aspx
title: 2010 Indian Chief Roadmaster

comments.text: Obviously this bike doesn't have self-canceling turn signals...﻿
comments.author: UltraSWG

comments.text: Man these bikes﻿ are beautiful
comments.author: bobrifleman

comments.text: Looking great but she needs﻿ some more ground clearance, on those gentle bends she was touching down.
comments.author: lotuselanplus2s

comments.text: just like old people, and my dad, dont realize the﻿ turn signal is still on. lol
comments.author: BrantFortunate

comments.text: Its a﻿ beeootiful bike but the price is to high for what you get.
comments.author: matrox

comments.text: "Own proprietary engine" my ass. ﻿ The Indian PowerPlus 105 is just an Evo clone with different shaped outer casings. Last I checked, Sportsters still use Evo engines.
comments.author: UltraSWG

comments.text: I own a 2000 Chief, which turns heads every time. I ride with 8 Harley guys,  when we pull up to a diner, people look at mine,  Yes, they are over priced. Mine isn't even rubber mounted, and came with no windshield or bags.﻿ And, you can't even lock the front end. It also bottoms out more than any other bike made, because they racked the front end on the early models. But, what a ride. Love those beach bars. Tim Andrew, Connecticut      youtube: timandrew1
comments.author: tim andrew

comments.text: This is a completely different bike then the ones made in 2000. In 2006 the company was bought by Stellican Limited and the bike has been completely re designed, renovated and re engineered to address﻿ past problems.
comments.author: justentime77

comments.text:
Its great to﻿ see an old company brought back to life, been reading up on how & why the company went bust; I still prefer the originals but it is good to see that name back on the road!

*So how much are they over there, if their so over-priced?
comments.author: anzac2404

comments.text: The﻿ Vintage Chief is $37,000.
comments.author: justentime77

comments.text: Mmmm.....that is a little steep but thats what we would pay out here for HD; so that's closer to $40,000 for us, then there's stamp duty etc etc.﻿
comments.author: anzac2404

comments.text:
Actually, this bike is just an improved version of the 2003 Chief made by Gilroy.  In 2003, the Gilroy Indian Chief came with the PowerPlus engine.

You put a 2003 Chief next to one of these and you won't see much difference.

What I really can't stand﻿ is how damn overpriced these bikes are.
comments.author: UltraSWG

comments.text: Wow! Didnt know they still made indians. How long ago did the﻿ brand come back? Just waiting for some cocksuckers saying they can`t call it indian cause it`s racist or some shit like that.
comments.author: 1986SoWhat

comments.text: Chief?﻿ Where's the Chief? Depicted here is all of a dull, skirted Heritage loaded with Ness's frenchy stuff, Victory+HD+SS+Daewoo 105 mill and so.But the Indian, where's the Indian?
comments.author: mutterschied

comments.text: I read in either Cycle World or Motorcycle Consumer﻿ News that for this kinda' money, one'd think he'd get a balanced engine or a rubber mounted motor. I bet it vibrates more than my REAL 1946 Chief. See my video of me on it at Stanroc after 25 APR 10.
comments.author: Rocky Rocheux

comments.text: They must have let an Asian woman﻿ drive this *blink blink*.
comments.author: PunchRockGroin

comments.text: Last name﻿ of harley and is riding a Indian. lol
comments.author: timber2020

comments.text: Indians have always been my favorite, just not my﻿ favorite price tag.
comments.author: beachpatrol1000

comments.text: his name is Harley and he is talking﻿ about Indian. Bloody classic
comments.author: rickinaus1

comments.text: nice bike!!!!!﻿
comments.author: chiliedog1

comments.text: - That is true...and the quality is second to none in the motorcycle world and could even rival some luxury European auto manufacturers! I just hope﻿ that this time it's for good! I understand that they've been having a bit of trouble finding buyers as the bike is quite expensive.
comments.author: thespeez

comments.text: lol anyone﻿ else notice he left his turn signal on?
comments.author: jacketfootball08

comments.text: Super Moto....My﻿ Dreams...
comments.author: Patrik Röman

comments.text: What a southern﻿ dialekt....!? Isn't it?
comments.author: Roadmaster1916

comments.text: Any of you 2002-2010 Indian Chief owners interested in replacing the stock exhaust with a﻿ new True-Dual Exhaust system, look at the new Indian True-Duals available from Freedom Performance Exhaust. Then, contact me at aaaexhaust@hotmail.com for a special discount price with FREE shipping. I am an authorized Freedom Performance Exhaust dealer.
comments.author: roadyrider

comments.text: Any of you 2002-2010 Indian Chief owners interested in replacing the stock exhaust with a new True-Dual Exhaust system, look at the new Indian True-Duals available from Freedom Performance Exhaust. Then, contact me at aaaexhaust@hotmail.com for a special discount price with FREE shipping. I am an authorized Freedom﻿ Performance Exhaust dealer.
comments.author: roadyrider

comments.text: They look really nice. But what is different than this tyme around. Have﻿ they done anything new?
comments.author: matrox

comments.text: See﻿ the new 2009-2010 Indian true-dual exhaust systems by Freedom Performance available on eBay.
comments.author: roadyrider

comments.text: $26,000. tooooooooooooo much﻿ for me
comments.author: fajadody

comments.text: I noticed as well. lol﻿
comments.author: leveebreaker7

comments.text: i want an indian. some ppl say its an old person bike but i﻿ say its like riding a work of art. so nostalgic
comments.author: MagnumPI4

comments.text: In terms of styling I like﻿ 1999-2003 Indian Chief Roadmaster better. I do hope that 2010 models have increased the overall reliability of the motorcycle though
comments.author: locsybrown

comments.text:
surely way a lot of bucks 
but the rice cookers are great too specially cruisers from yamaha and kawasaki are great bikes too and﻿ just half the price of a harley or indian
comments.author: aphasia1972

comments.text: Yeah. but what about retaining their value??? ﻿
comments.author: fajadody

comments.text: ok thats somethin different but if you take care about the bike doesnt matter specially yamahas have the best price value and is very constant kawasaki too but it depends on the condition of the bikes too and etc but if you are not a pro bike dealer get one rice cooker and enjoy the ride buddy up to you i have one and i enjoy my VULCAN 1500 Classic i never rid emy bike when its raining outside i am not a pussy but﻿ i care about my money and my bike
comments.author: aphasia1972

comments.text: Really am glad to see this company coming back.﻿  Beautiful bike.
comments.author: tburtont1

comments.text: I ride in a big group.I have always liked the Indian.My cousin had a 47 all restored.But I cant get over the price.I﻿ might have to stick to Yamaha.At least until I win the lottery.Its too bad they are so high in price.Especially since they are starting out again.Greed must be a factor.Just like Harley.
comments.author: 5carts

comments.text: MY PROBLEM with the New Indians are.... The Bike Is To Stretched Out Looking... to much space between the frame and back of front fender.  Sits to high from ground to frame.... To much open space between motor and frame under seat area... Looks like the front forks are like 4 inches over from what it should be and the front fender doesn't cover enough of the front wheel.. Id buy a NEW Indian if these things were changed... My 2003 Kawasaki Drifter Looks more﻿ like an Indian the Indian does!
comments.author: GasserGlass

comments.text: The﻿ Drifter is just as much of an Indian as any new Indian is.  All new Chiefs after 1953 are replicas.  Strange how Kawasaki made the best Indian Chief replicas.  Drifters look better and are better made.  Fuel injected, shaft drive, liquid cooled, with a fender attached to the swingarm for that low look.  Simply an amazing machine.  Frankly, they are the Chiefs that Gilroy should have made.
comments.author: UltraSWG

comments.text: Turn signals work﻿ quite well.
comments.author: kootenaylad

comments.text: See my 'Indian Chief Motorcycle Exhaust Pipes' video on youtube for all new﻿ true-dual exhaust pipes for all 2009-2011 Indian Chiefs and 2002-2003 Gilroy Indian Chiefs made by Freedom Performance. Contact me at aaaexhaust@hotmail.com for more info.
comments.author: roadyrider

comments.text: this guys name is harley    =-)﻿
comments.author: wandoX

comments.text: Once again Indians are﻿ air cooled....right?
comments.author: acesobrian

comments.text: Didn't even say if it﻿ was a shaft or chain. I'm going to guess that it's a shaft. The price must indicate that Indian doesn't expect for there to be an Indian motorcycle at every red light. If I ever become idly rich I'll get one. BTW, isn't odd how the original Indian was the crotchrocket of its day but today it's completely opposite?
comments.author: oeyesea

comments.text: it is belt﻿ driven
comments.author: TheIndianscout

comments.text: yes its air cooled﻿
comments.author: TheIndianscout

comments.text: Seems they would have redone﻿ their video with the blinker on all the time.
comments.author: rlawrence2

comments.text: It appears there is a short in the turn signal as it continues even when the switch is OFF. I don't think he wanted to point﻿ that out in his review.
comments.author: TheNewton380

comments.text: My﻿ god!!!
comments.author: BEHEDETY

comments.text: but who would want that anyways, I love pushing in that cancel﻿ switch
comments.author: CmoreBuhts

comments.text: What an absolute piece of junk.  All this chromed-out turd really is, is a Harley FLSTC with an inflated price tag and 400lbs. of extra crap.  The FLSTC is 18 stacks, this phony "Indian"'s gotta be at least 20, if not 25.  All you're paying for is the name.  Anyone who buys this ugly-ass land yacht is a sucker.  It's aimed at the same kind of Einstein﻿ who buys an Escalade instead paying thousands less for a Tahoe, not knowing that it's exactly the same truck.  Morons.
comments.author: t1201971

comments.text: How﻿ far can this bike go on 1 full tank ?
comments.author: fightclubmeber8

comments.text: Redesigned evo motor and﻿ all... if only eller industries had got the rights and built theirs. The guy also said he got asked If it's a new bike or an old Bike. Thats just plain retarted... If people can't tell they are weekend worrior posers.
comments.author: KerPlunkItDude

comments.text: SO TRUE!!﻿
comments.author: t1201971

comments.text: This video should be titled... "Learn to Cancel Your Signals" (because otherwise you look like a dork and while riding an Indian, that is NOT a good thing)!﻿
comments.author: kootenaylad

comments.text: Never understood how they could sell﻿ a re-badged Harley clone as an Indian, or that people would actually buy one. Got to admit, it took some balls to do that, and do it with a straight face.
comments.author: CrazyAlvis

comments.text: Im not sure﻿ how it qualifies as a re-badged h-d? It is an american build bike but otherwise how so?
comments.author: ajwilbanks

comments.text:
An H-D and indian are
﻿ as different as a ford and chevy.
comments.author: ajwilbanks

comments.text: Indian started making motorcycles in 1901, 2 years before HD.﻿
comments.author: BestestMoron

comments.text:
Indian started making motorcycles﻿ in 1901, 2 years before﻿ HD.

Talking of HD, when you figure out why anyone would buy that piece of shit when you can get a refined, modern-engineered, won't-break-down-all-the-time Honda or Yamaha, you will understand why people﻿ buy the Indian!
comments.author: BestestMoron

comments.text:
No fucking shit douchebag.
They didn't use﻿ Harley engine either.
comments.author: CrazyAlvis

comments.text: Then WTF are stupid﻿ harley sluts like you crying the Indian is a harley﻿ re-badge?
comments.author: BestestMoron

comments.text: It is based on a copy of a Harley. The engine is simply a redecorated S&S copy of the HD Evo. People who actually KNOW Indians know they are nothing like a HD except for the﻿ part where they have two wheels. From the layout of the engine, to the suspension to the frame, none of it is similar to a HD. An Indian has more in common with Brit/Euro bikes of the period.
comments.author: CrazyAlvis

comments.text: Harley SLUT? Too damn lazy or stupid to view my page I see. I wouldn't ride a HD if I was paid. You are the moron here. You don't even know Indians﻿ for please, just go away. Spare yourself the embarrassment.
comments.author: CrazyAlvis

comments.text: indians are so beautiful and are far less common than Harleys. The roadmaster﻿ is my dream bike. im still stuck with my honda but I like it too:)
comments.author: carlover89

comments.text: , self-canceling turn﻿ signals is﻿ not true =)
comments.author: Антон Бузмаков

comments.text: Yea﻿ not so much...
comments.author: ajwilbanks

comments.text: If thats the case H-D Pretty much copied indian in everything since 1903. Your'e splitting hairs. The S&S isnt a copy its a revised well improved version alot of differences pretty much like a ford 302 and a chevy 350 still use a v8 configuration doesnt﻿ mean its a copy.
comments.author: ajwilbanks

comments.text: Are you stupid? That engine is a COPY﻿ of the HD big twin! S&S copied the Evo (yes COPY look it up in the dictionary) and Indian originally used an S&S. The God-damned thing will bolt right into a HD! Then they redecorated the thing to pass it﻿ off as their own. The internals are damn near THE SAME. We aren't talking engine configuration (is that word too big for you?) we are talking carbon f'ing copy.
comments.author: CrazyAlvis

comments.text: PIĘKNY!!!﻿ Moje nie spełnione marzenie!!!
comments.author: michalmzetz250

comments.text: i like how indian has kept to their roots, harley has lost its sense of direction with its﻿ design a little.
comments.author: MagnumPI4
